tasks.title: Create Base .claude Directory Structure
tasks.description: Establish the foundational directory structure for the CCDK integration project that will house all components from the six enhancement kits.
tasks.details:
Create the following directory structure:
- .claude/
  - commands/
  - agents/
  - hooks/
  - config/
  - memory/
  - analytics/
  - templates/
  - docs/
  - web/

Ensure proper permissions are set for cross-platform compatibility. Use fs-extra (v11.1.1+) for robust file operations that work consistently across platforms. Include .gitignore file to exclude sensitive data and large binary files. Create README.md files in each directory explaining its purpose.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify all directories are created with correct permissions. Test on both Windows and Unix-based systems to ensure path separators work correctly. Validate directory structure against requirements using a directory structure validation script.

subtasks.title: Create Top-Level Directories
subtasks.description: Establish the required top-level directories for the project, ensuring the structure is clear and organized for cross-platform compatibility.
subtasks.details: Use platform-agnostic commands or scripts to create each top-level directory. Confirm that directory names follow naming conventions suitable for both Windows and Unix systems.

subtasks.title: Set Directory Permissions for Cross-Platform Compatibility
subtasks.description: Configure directory permissions to ensure accessibility and security across both Windows and Unix environments.
subtasks.details: Apply permission settings that are compatible with both operating systems, such as using chmod for Unix and adjusting ACLs for Windows. Document any platform-specific considerations.

subtasks.title: Add .gitignore Files and Configure Exclusions
subtasks.description: Create .gitignore files in appropriate directories and specify patterns to exclude files and folders that should not be tracked by version control.
subtasks.details: Ensure .gitignore syntax is valid and covers platform-specific files (e.g., Thumbs.db for Windows, .DS_Store for macOS). Place .gitignore files at the root and in subdirectories as needed.

subtasks.title: Create README.md Files with Directory-Specific Content
subtasks.description: Generate README.md files in each directory, providing documentation relevant to the contents and purpose of each directory. [Updated: 8/1/2025]
subtasks.details:
Write clear, concise content for each README.md, describing the directory's role and any special instructions or conventions.

Created README.md files for all subdirectories in the .claude/ structure. Each README includes a clear description of the directory's purpose, usage guidelines, and any special conventions to follow. The documentation provides sufficient context for new team members to understand the organization of the project files and how to properly use each directory.
</info added on 2025-08-01T15:54:31.921Z>

subtasks.title: Validate Directory Structure and Permissions on Windows and Unix
subtasks.description: Verify that the directory structure, permissions, and configuration files function correctly on both Windows and Unix systems.
subtasks.details: Test directory creation, access, and version control exclusions on both platforms. Document any issues found and confirm that all requirements are met.

tasks.title: Initialize Base Configuration Files
tasks.description: Create initial configuration files that will be used to merge settings from all enhancement kits.
tasks.details:
Create the following base configuration files:
- .claude/config/settings.json: Main configuration file with sections for commands, agents, hooks, and system settings
- .claude/config/models.json: AI model configurations
- .claude/config/memory.json: Memory persistence settings
- .claude/config/analytics.json: Analytics configuration

Use JSON Schema (draft-07) to define the structure of each configuration file. Implement with Node.js fs module and JSON5 (v2.2.3+) for comments support in configuration files. Include version field in each config file for future compatibility checks.
tasks.testStrategy: Validate all configuration files against their JSON schemas. Ensure files are properly formatted and contain all required sections. Test loading configurations with sample values to verify structure.

subtasks.title: Design JSON Schemas for Each Config File
subtasks.description: Create detailed JSON Schema definitions for each configuration file, specifying required fields, types, and constraints to ensure structure and validation compatibility.
subtasks.details: Use JSON Schema V4 or later. Define root object, properties, required fields, and use $defs for reusable subschemas as needed.

subtasks.title: Implement File Creation with JSON5 Support
subtasks.description: Develop logic to generate configuration files in JSON5 format, ensuring compatibility with comments and relaxed syntax.
subtasks.details: Utilize a JSON5 library for reading/writing. Ensure generated files conform to the designed schemas but allow JSON5 features.

subtasks.title: Add Version Fields to Config Files and Schemas
subtasks.description: Integrate a version field into each configuration file and its corresponding schema to support future migrations and compatibility checks.
subtasks.details: Define a 'version' property in both the schema and the initial config content. Decide on versioning format (e.g., semantic versioning).

subtasks.title: Write Initial Content for Each Config File
subtasks.description: Populate each configuration file with default or example values that conform to the schema, including the version field.
subtasks.details: Ensure all required fields are present and provide sensible defaults. Use JSON5 syntax where appropriate.

subtasks.title: Validate Config Files Against Schemas
subtasks.description: Implement validation logic to check that each configuration file matches its schema, including type checks and required fields.
subtasks.details: Use a JSON Schema validator that supports JSON5 input, or convert JSON5 to JSON before validation. Report validation errors clearly.

subtasks.title: Test Configuration Loading with Sample Values
subtasks.description: Develop and run tests to load configuration files with various sample values, verifying correct parsing, validation, and error handling.
subtasks.details: Include tests for valid and invalid configurations, version mismatches, and JSON5-specific syntax.

tasks.title: Implement Configuration Merger Utility
tasks.description: Create a utility to merge configuration files from all enhancement kits without conflicts.
tasks.details:
Develop a Node.js utility (config-merger.js) that:
1. Loads configuration files from each kit
2. Performs deep merge with conflict resolution
3. Validates merged configuration against schemas
4. Writes final configuration files

Use deepmerge (v4.3.1+) for robust object merging. Implement conflict resolution strategy that prioritizes newer kit versions. Add logging for merge conflicts. Include CLI interface for manual merging when needed. Handle array deduplication for hook registrations.
tasks.testStrategy: Test with sample configurations from all kits. Verify conflict resolution works correctly. Validate final configuration against schema. Create test cases for common conflict scenarios. Ensure hook registrations are unique in the final configuration.

subtasks.title: Load Configuration Files from Kits
subtasks.description: Implement logic to discover, read, and parse configuration files from specified kits, supporting multiple file formats (e.g., YAML, JSON).
subtasks.details: Ensure robust error handling for missing or malformed files. Support recursive loading if kits include other kits.

subtasks.title: Implement Deep Merge Logic
subtasks.description: Develop a deep merge utility that recursively merges nested objects and arrays according to defined rules.
subtasks.details: Handle merging of dictionaries/maps, arrays/lists, and primitive values. Ensure that nested structures are merged at any depth, with later sources overriding earlier ones for conflicting primitive values.

subtasks.title: Design Conflict Resolution Strategy
subtasks.description: Define and implement a strategy for resolving conflicts when the same key exists in multiple configuration sources.
subtasks.details: Specify precedence rules (e.g., last-in-wins, explicit override markers). Document and handle edge cases such as type mismatches or incompatible structures.

subtasks.title: Schema Validation of Merged Configuration
subtasks.description: Validate the merged configuration against a predefined schema to ensure correctness and completeness.
subtasks.details: Use a schema validation library to check types, required fields, and value constraints. Provide clear error messages for validation failures.

subtasks.title: Implement Logging and CLI Interface
subtasks.description: Add logging for key operations and errors, and build a command-line interface for user interaction.
subtasks.details: Support configurable log levels and output formats. Design CLI commands for loading, merging, validating, and outputting configuration.

subtasks.title: Array Deduplication for Hooks
subtasks.description: Implement logic to deduplicate arrays (specifically for hooks) during the merge process.
subtasks.details: Define criteria for deduplication (e.g., unique by name or content). Integrate deduplication into the deep merge pipeline.

subtasks.title: Write and Test Final Output
subtasks.description: Generate the final merged configuration file and develop comprehensive tests to verify correctness across diverse input sets.
subtasks.details: Write unit and integration tests covering edge cases, error handling, and schema compliance. Output the merged configuration in the desired format.

tasks.title: Setup Dependency Management System
tasks.description: Establish the dependency management system for the integrated CCDK, supporting Node.js, Bun, and Python requirements.
tasks.details:
Create package.json with all JavaScript dependencies. Include:
- Node.js dependencies: better-sqlite3 (v8.5.0+), express (v4.18.2+), socket.io (v4.7.2+)
- Development dependencies: eslint (v8.50.0+), jest (v29.7.0+)

Create requirements.txt for Python dependencies:
- flask==2.3.3
- mkdocs==1.5.3
- mkdocs-material==9.4.2
- pytest==7.4.2

Implement a dependency checker script that verifies all required tools (Node.js, Bun, Python, Git) are installed with correct versions. Use semver (v7.5.4+) for version comparison.
tasks.testStrategy: Run dependency checker on different environments. Verify all dependencies can be installed cleanly. Test with Node.js 18+ and Python 3.11+. Validate Bun installation and compatibility. Ensure GitHub CLI is properly configured.

subtasks.title: Create package.json and Add JavaScript Dependencies
subtasks.description: Initialize a Node.js project by creating a package.json file and specifying all required JavaScript dependencies and devDependencies.
subtasks.details: Run `npm init` or `npm init -y` in the project directory to generate package.json. Add necessary dependencies using `npm install <package-name>` for production and `npm install <package-name> --save-dev` for development. Ensure all required packages are listed under the appropriate sections.

subtasks.title: Create requirements.txt for Python Dependencies
subtasks.description: Generate a requirements.txt file listing all Python dependencies needed for the project.
subtasks.details: Identify all Python packages required for the project. Use `pip freeze > requirements.txt` if dependencies are already installed, or manually list them with specific versions. Ensure the file is up to date and accurately reflects the project's needs.

subtasks.title: Implement Dependency Checker Script
subtasks.description: Develop a script that checks for the presence and correct versions of both JavaScript and Python dependencies as specified in package.json and requirements.txt.
subtasks.details: Write a cross-language script (e.g., in Python or Node.js) that parses package.json and requirements.txt, verifies installed packages, and reports missing or mismatched versions. The script should provide clear output for any discrepancies.

subtasks.title: Integrate Semantic Versioning (semver) for Version Checks
subtasks.description: Enhance the dependency checker script to use semantic versioning rules for validating package versions.
subtasks.details: Incorporate a semver library (such as the 'semver' npm package or Python's 'semver' module) to accurately compare installed package versions against specified version ranges in package.json and requirements.txt.

subtasks.title: Test Installations on Multiple Environments
subtasks.description: Verify that dependency installation and the checker script work correctly across different operating systems and runtime environments.
subtasks.details: Set up test environments (e.g., Windows, macOS, Linux, different Node.js and Python versions). Run installation commands and the checker script in each environment, documenting any issues or incompatibilities encountered.

subtasks.title: Validate Tool Installations and Compatibility
subtasks.description: Ensure that all required tools and dependencies are installed correctly and are compatible with each other across supported environments.
subtasks.details: Run functional tests to confirm that all tools (Node.js, npm, Python, pip, etc.) and dependencies operate as expected together. Address any conflicts or incompatibilities, and update documentation to reflect supported configurations.

tasks.title: Implement Hook Registration System
tasks.description: Create a system to register and manage hooks from all enhancement kits, ensuring each hook is registered exactly once.
tasks.details:
Develop a hook registration system that:
1. Loads hook definitions from all kits
2. Validates hook interfaces
3. Registers hooks in the correct execution order
4. Prevents duplicate registrations

Implement using TypeScript with Bun runtime for performance. Create hook registry class with methods for registration, deregistration, and execution. Use event emitter pattern for hook triggering. Store hook configurations in settings.json with metadata about source kit and priority.
tasks.testStrategy: Test registration of duplicate hooks to ensure only one instance is kept. Verify hooks execute in the correct order. Test hook execution with mock events. Validate error handling for failed hooks. Ensure hooks from all kits are properly registered.

subtasks.title: Loading Hook Definitions
subtasks.description: Load all available hook definitions from the specified sources or configuration files.
subtasks.details: This involves scanning directories, reading configuration files, or importing modules to gather all hook definitions that need to be registered.

subtasks.title: Validating Hook Interfaces
subtasks.description: Validate that each loaded hook conforms to the required interface or contract.
subtasks.details: Check that each hook implements the necessary methods, signatures, and metadata as specified by the system's interface requirements.

subtasks.title: Registering Hooks with Order Management
subtasks.description: Register validated hooks in the system, ensuring their execution order is managed according to configuration or priority.
subtasks.details: Insert hooks into a registry or manager, maintaining the correct order for execution (e.g., by priority or explicit ordering rules).

subtasks.title: Preventing Duplicates
subtasks.description: Ensure that duplicate hooks are not registered, based on unique identifiers or signatures.
subtasks.details: Implement logic to detect and prevent the registration of hooks with the same name, type, or other unique property.

subtasks.title: Implementing Registry Class
subtasks.description: Develop a registry class to manage the lifecycle, storage, and retrieval of hooks.
subtasks.details: The registry should provide methods for adding, removing, querying, and iterating over hooks, as well as enforcing deduplication and order.

subtasks.title: Event Emitter Integration
subtasks.description: Integrate an event emitter to trigger hooks in response to system events.
subtasks.details: Connect the registry to an event emitter so that hooks are executed when relevant events occur, supporting an event-driven architecture.

subtasks.title: Storing Metadata in Config
subtasks.description: Store and manage hook metadata within the system configuration for extensibility and introspection.
subtasks.details: Ensure that metadata such as hook names, types, priorities, and descriptions are stored in a structured configuration object or file.

tasks.title: Implement SQLite-based Memory System
tasks.description: Create the persistent memory system using SQLite to store context across Claude sessions.
tasks.details:
Implement memory persistence system using better-sqlite3 (v8.5.0+):
1. Create database schema with tables for:
   - sessions (id, start_time, end_time, metadata)
   - memory_chunks (id, session_id, content, embedding, timestamp)
   - projects (id, name, path, last_accessed)
   - context (id, project_id, key, value, timestamp)
2. Implement memory manager class with CRUD operations
3. Add indexing for performance optimization
4. Implement automatic pruning of old memories

Use prepared statements for all database operations. Implement connection pooling for performance. Add transaction support for atomic operations. Include database migration system for future schema updates.
tasks.testStrategy: Test CRUD operations on all tables. Verify persistence across application restarts. Benchmark performance for large memory operations. Test concurrent access scenarios. Validate memory pruning functionality. Ensure database integrity with foreign key constraints.

subtasks.title: Design Database Schema
subtasks.description: Analyze requirements, define entities, relationships, and constraints, and create a normalized schema that supports project goals.
subtasks.details: Gather requirements, create an entity-relationship diagram, normalize tables, define data types, and establish primary/foreign keys.

subtasks.title: Implement Memory Manager Class
subtasks.description: Develop a class responsible for efficient memory allocation, deallocation, and management for database operations.
subtasks.details: Design interfaces for memory allocation, implement pooling or caching strategies, and ensure thread safety if needed.

subtasks.title: Implement CRUD Operations for All Tables
subtasks.description: Develop Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations for each table defined in the schema.
subtasks.details: Write functions or methods for each CRUD operation, ensuring data integrity and validation according to schema constraints.

subtasks.title: Indexing and Performance Optimization
subtasks.description: Design and implement indexes to optimize query performance and analyze query plans for bottlenecks.
subtasks.details: Identify columns for indexing, create appropriate indexes, and use query profiling tools to optimize slow queries.

subtasks.title: Implement Automatic Pruning
subtasks.description: Develop mechanisms to automatically remove obsolete or expired data from tables to maintain performance and storage efficiency.
subtasks.details: Define pruning criteria, schedule pruning jobs, and ensure safe deletion without violating referential integrity.

subtasks.title: Implement Prepared Statements and Connection Pooling
subtasks.description: Integrate prepared statements for secure, efficient queries and set up connection pooling for scalable database access.
subtasks.details: Refactor queries to use prepared statements, configure a connection pool, and tune pool parameters for concurrency.

subtasks.title: Add Transaction Support
subtasks.description: Implement transaction management to ensure atomicity, consistency, isolation, and durability (ACID) for multi-step operations.
subtasks.details: Wrap critical operations in transactions, handle commit/rollback logic, and test for concurrency issues.

subtasks.title: Develop Database Migration System
subtasks.description: Create a system for managing schema changes, versioning, and applying migrations safely across environments.
subtasks.details: Design migration scripts, implement version tracking, and automate migration application with rollback support.

tasks.title: Implement Memory Auto-loading Hook
tasks.description: Create a hook that automatically loads relevant memory when a new Claude session starts.
tasks.details:
Implement a session-start hook that:
1. Detects the current project context
2. Queries the memory database for relevant context
3. Loads appropriate memory chunks based on relevance
4. Injects context into the Claude session

Use vector similarity search for context relevance. Implement memory chunk selection algorithm that optimizes for context window utilization. Add configuration options for memory loading behavior. Include telemetry for memory usage statistics.
tasks.testStrategy: Test memory loading with various project contexts. Verify relevant memories are prioritized. Measure context injection performance. Test with different memory database sizes. Validate behavior with empty memory database.

subtasks.title: Detect Project Context
subtasks.description: Identify and extract the relevant project context required for memory operations, such as project identifiers, user session data, and current workflow state.
subtasks.details: This step involves parsing incoming requests or session data to determine which project or environment is active, ensuring subsequent memory operations are scoped correctly.

subtasks.title: Query Memory Database
subtasks.description: Formulate and execute queries against the memory database to retrieve stored memory chunks associated with the detected project context.
subtasks.details: Utilize the project context to construct efficient queries, leveraging indexing or caching strategies as appropriate for performance.

subtasks.title: Select Relevant Memory Chunks
subtasks.description: Apply relevance algorithms to filter and rank retrieved memory chunks based on their contextual similarity and importance to the current session.
subtasks.details: Implement or integrate relevance scoring mechanisms (e.g., semantic similarity, recency, frequency) to ensure only the most pertinent memory chunks are selected.

subtasks.title: Inject Context into Session
subtasks.description: Integrate the selected relevant memory chunks into the active session, making them available for downstream processing or user interaction.
subtasks.details: Update session state or context objects with the selected memory data, ensuring consistency and accessibility for subsequent operations.

subtasks.title: Configure Memory Loading Options
subtasks.description: Determine and apply configuration options for memory loading, such as chunk size, prefetching strategies, and memory usage limits.
subtasks.details: Allow for dynamic adjustment of memory loading parameters based on project requirements, user preferences, or system constraints.

subtasks.title: Add Telemetry for Usage Statistics
subtasks.description: Instrument the memory system to collect and report telemetry data on memory usage, query performance, and relevance algorithm effectiveness.
subtasks.details: Implement logging and metrics collection at key points in the workflow to enable monitoring, debugging, and optimization of the memory integration process.

tasks.title: Implement Memory Saving Hook
tasks.description: Create a hook that saves session context to the memory database when a Claude session ends.
tasks.details:
Implement a session-end hook that:
1. Extracts important context from the Claude session
2. Processes and chunks the context for efficient storage
3. Stores chunks in the memory database with metadata
4. Updates session records

Implement intelligent chunking algorithm that preserves semantic meaning. Use importance scoring to prioritize valuable information. Add configuration for memory retention policies. Include compression for large memory chunks.
tasks.testStrategy: Test memory saving with various session types. Verify chunks are properly stored with correct metadata. Test with large sessions to ensure performance. Validate compression and decompression functionality. Ensure session records are properly updated.

subtasks.title: Extract Session Context
subtasks.description: Identify and extract relevant contextual information from the current session using advanced entity and context extraction techniques.
subtasks.details: Apply contextual entity extraction and NLP methods to capture entities, relationships, and themes from session data. Ensure both structured and unstructured data are considered.

subtasks.title: Chunk and Process Context
subtasks.description: Divide the extracted session context into manageable chunks and process each chunk for downstream storage and retrieval.
subtasks.details: Implement intelligent chunking strategies based on semantic boundaries, size limits, or logical divisions. Process each chunk to normalize and prepare for metadata tagging.

subtasks.title: Store Chunks with Metadata
subtasks.description: Persist each processed chunk along with comprehensive metadata for efficient indexing and retrieval.
subtasks.details: Design a storage schema that associates each chunk with metadata such as source, timestamp, entity types, and context tags. Ensure storage supports efficient querying.

subtasks.title: Update Session Records
subtasks.description: Maintain and update session records to reflect the latest context extraction and chunk storage operations.
subtasks.details: Track the mapping between session identifiers and stored chunks. Update session logs and indexes to ensure consistency and traceability.

subtasks.title: Implement Compression
subtasks.description: Apply compression algorithms to stored chunks to optimize storage efficiency without compromising retrieval speed or data integrity.
subtasks.details: Select and integrate suitable compression techniques (e.g., lossless text compression) for chunk data. Validate decompression and access workflows.

subtasks.title: Configure Retention Policies
subtasks.description: Define and enforce retention policies for stored chunks and session records to manage data lifecycle and compliance.
subtasks.details: Establish rules for data expiration, archival, and deletion based on metadata attributes and organizational requirements. Automate policy enforcement.

tasks.title: Implement Security Audit Command
tasks.description: Create a command for scanning code for security vulnerabilities.
tasks.details:
Implement a security audit command that:
1. Scans project code for common security vulnerabilities
2. Integrates with popular security scanning tools
3. Generates a comprehensive security report
4. Suggests fixes for identified issues

Use npm audit for JavaScript dependencies. Integrate with Bandit (v1.7.5+) for Python code scanning. Add support for OWASP dependency checker. Implement custom rules for common security issues. Include severity classification for findings. Support output in multiple formats (JSON, HTML, Markdown).
tasks.testStrategy: Test with projects containing known vulnerabilities. Verify all vulnerability types are detected. Test performance with large codebases. Validate report generation in all supported formats. Ensure suggested fixes are accurate and applicable.

subtasks.title: Integrate npm audit for JavaScript projects
subtasks.description: Set up and automate the use of npm audit to scan JavaScript project dependencies for known vulnerabilities.
subtasks.details: Configure CI/CD pipelines to run npm audit on every build. Ensure audit reports are collected and stored for further processing.

subtasks.title: Integrate Bandit for Python projects
subtasks.description: Implement Bandit to analyze Python code for security issues and automate its execution within the development workflow.
subtasks.details: Install Bandit, configure it with appropriate profiles, and automate its execution in CI/CD pipelines. Collect and store Bandit reports.

subtasks.title: Add OWASP Dependency-Check integration
subtasks.description: Integrate OWASP Dependency-Check to scan project dependencies across supported languages for known vulnerabilities.
subtasks.details: Set up Dependency-Check for all relevant project types, configure scanning rules, and automate report generation in the build process.

subtasks.title: Implement custom security rules
subtasks.description: Develop and integrate custom security rules to address project-specific or organization-specific security requirements.
subtasks.details: Define custom rules for both static analysis and dependency scanning. Integrate these rules into the existing scanning tools or as separate scripts.

subtasks.title: Classify vulnerabilities by severity
subtasks.description: Establish a system to classify and prioritize vulnerabilities based on severity across all integrated tools.
subtasks.details: Map severity levels from each tool to a unified classification scheme (e.g., Critical, High, Medium, Low). Ensure all findings are consistently categorized.

subtasks.title: Generate reports in multiple formats
subtasks.description: Develop a reporting mechanism that consolidates findings and outputs them in various formats such as HTML, JSON, and CSV.
subtasks.details: Aggregate results from all tools, apply severity classification, and generate comprehensive reports in the required formats for stakeholders.

subtasks.title: Suggest fixes for identified vulnerabilities
subtasks.description: Provide actionable remediation guidance for each identified vulnerability, including automated fix suggestions where possible.
subtasks.details: Leverage tool recommendations (e.g., npm audit fix), community advisories, and custom logic to suggest fixes. Include these suggestions in the generated reports.

tasks.title: Implement Automated Test Runner
tasks.description: Create a command for running tests with support for multiple testing frameworks.
tasks.details:
Implement a test runner command that:
1. Detects project type and testing framework
2. Runs appropriate tests based on context
3. Generates test reports with coverage information
4. Integrates with CI/CD pipelines

Support Jest for JavaScript/TypeScript, pytest for Python, and other common frameworks. Implement test discovery to find relevant tests. Add parallel test execution for performance. Include code coverage reporting with istanbul/nyc for JS and coverage.py for Python. Support filtering tests by pattern or tag.
tasks.testStrategy: Test with projects using different testing frameworks. Verify test discovery works correctly. Validate test reports and coverage information. Test performance with large test suites. Ensure CI/CD integration works properly.

subtasks.title: Detect Project Type and Framework
subtasks.description: Identify the programming language, project type, and testing framework(s) used in the codebase.
subtasks.details: Analyze project files (e.g., package manifests, config files) to determine if the project uses frameworks like Jest, Pytest, JUnit, etc. Support detection for multi-framework and hybrid setups.

subtasks.title: Implement Test Discovery Logic
subtasks.description: Develop logic to automatically discover all available tests in the detected framework(s).
subtasks.details: Use framework-specific conventions and APIs to enumerate test cases, suites, and modules. Ensure extensibility for new frameworks and hybrid scenarios.

subtasks.title: Enable Test Filtering Support
subtasks.description: Allow users to filter which tests to run based on criteria such as name, tags, or file path.
subtasks.details: Integrate filtering mechanisms compatible with each supported framework. Provide a unified interface for specifying filters.

subtasks.title: Run Appropriate Tests
subtasks.description: Execute the discovered and filtered tests using the correct framework-specific runners.
subtasks.details: Invoke the appropriate test runner(s) with the selected tests. Handle multi-framework orchestration and error reporting.

subtasks.title: Implement Parallel Test Execution
subtasks.description: Add support for running tests in parallel to improve execution speed.
subtasks.details: Leverage framework-native parallelization features or implement custom parallel execution logic. Ensure thread/process safety and correct result aggregation.

subtasks.title: Integrate Coverage Reporting
subtasks.description: Collect and report code coverage metrics for the executed tests.
subtasks.details: Use framework or language-specific coverage tools to generate reports. Aggregate results across parallel runs and multiple frameworks if needed.

subtasks.title: Support CI/CD Integration
subtasks.description: Enable seamless integration of the testing workflow into popular CI/CD pipelines.
subtasks.details: Provide configuration examples and scripts for CI/CD platforms (e.g., GitHub Actions, Jenkins). Ensure outputs (test results, coverage) are compatible with CI/CD reporting tools.

tasks.title: Implement Git PR Creation Command
tasks.description: Create a command for generating and submitting GitHub pull requests with templates.
tasks.details:
Implement a PR creation command that:
1. Generates PR description from templates
2. Includes relevant context from the current work
3. Submits PR using GitHub CLI
4. Adds appropriate labels and reviewers

Use GitHub CLI (gh) for PR submission. Implement template system with variables for dynamic content. Add support for custom PR templates. Include automatic issue linking based on branch naming conventions. Support draft PRs for work in progress.
tasks.testStrategy: Test PR creation with various templates. Verify PR descriptions are correctly generated. Test with different repository structures. Validate GitHub CLI integration. Ensure labels and reviewers are correctly assigned.

subtasks.title: Design and Implement PR Description Template System
subtasks.description: Create a standardized, customizable template system for pull request (PR) descriptions to ensure consistency and clarity across all PRs.
subtasks.details: Define required sections (e.g., summary, context, testing steps, related issues) and implement logic to generate or insert templates into PRs automatically.

subtasks.title: Automate Context Extraction from Current Work
subtasks.description: Develop mechanisms to extract relevant context from the current branch, commit history, and code changes to pre-fill PR templates.
subtasks.details: Implement logic to gather information such as branch name, recent commits, linked issues, and code diffs to populate template fields.

subtasks.title: Integrate with GitHub CLI
subtasks.description: Enable seamless interaction with GitHub via the command-line interface (CLI) for creating and managing PRs using the template system.
subtasks.details: Develop CLI commands or scripts to automate PR creation, template insertion, and metadata updates directly from the terminal.

subtasks.title: Automate Label and Reviewer Assignment
subtasks.description: Implement automation for assigning appropriate labels and reviewers to PRs based on extracted context and repository configuration.
subtasks.details: Use rules or AI to suggest or auto-assign labels and reviewers, integrating with GitHub's API for updates.

subtasks.title: Support Issue Linking and Draft PR Creation
subtasks.description: Add features to link PRs to relevant issues and support the creation of draft PRs for early feedback.
subtasks.details: Implement logic to detect and link related issues, and provide options to open PRs as drafts via the CLI integration.

tasks.title: Implement Context-specific Loaders
tasks.description: Create loaders for different development contexts, with a focus on frontend development.
tasks.details:
Implement context-specific loaders that:
1. Detect project type and framework
2. Load relevant documentation and best practices
3. Configure Claude with context-specific knowledge
4. Set up appropriate tools and commands

Support React, Vue, Angular, and other popular frontend frameworks. Include framework-specific best practices and patterns. Add automatic detection of build systems (webpack, vite, etc.). Support TypeScript configuration loading. Include accessibility guidelines relevant to the detected framework.
tasks.testStrategy: Test with different frontend project types. Verify correct framework detection. Validate loaded documentation and best practices. Test with various build systems. Ensure TypeScript configuration is correctly loaded.

subtasks.title: Project Type and Framework Detection
subtasks.description: Identify the type of project (e.g., AI, web, mobile) and detect the primary framework or library in use (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, React).
subtasks.details: Analyze project files, configuration files, and directory structure to determine the main technology stack and framework. This may involve parsing package manifests (e.g., package.json, requirements.txt) and scanning for framework-specific files.

subtasks.title: Loading Documentation and Best Practices
subtasks.description: Gather and load relevant documentation, coding standards, and best practices for the detected project type and framework.
subtasks.details: Fetch official documentation, community guides, and best practice resources tailored to the identified framework. Organize this information for easy reference and integration into subsequent steps.

subtasks.title: Configuring Claude with Context Knowledge

tasks.testStrategy: Test with various completed tasks. Verify summaries contain relevant information. Validate diff analysis for code changes. Test with different task types. Ensure summaries are stored correctly in the memory database.

subtasks.title: Task Analysis Logic Implementation

subtasks.title: Key Information Extraction Module
subtasks.description: Design and implement a module to extract essential information from input data, such as user actions, task steps, and relevant metadata.

subtasks.title: Summary Generation Engine

subtasks.title: Diff Analysis for Code Changes

subtasks.title: Metadata Inclusion Mechanism

subtasks.title: Configurable Summary Formats

subtasks.title: Record Search Results and User Interactions
subtasks.description: Log the results returned for each search and track user interactions with those results, such as clicks, refinements, or follow-up actions.

subtasks.title: Assist with Configuration and Automation
subtasks.description: Support the creation, validation, and troubleshooting of configuration files and automation scripts for deployment and infrastructure management.
subtasks.details: Review and refine scripts (e.g., YAML, Terraform, Ansible) and automation pipelines to ensure reliability, repeatability, and compliance with best practices.

subtasks.title: Support Cloud Platform-Specific Issues
subtasks.description: Address cloud platform-specific deployment and infrastructure challenges, including those related to Azure, AWS, GCP, or Oracle Cloud.
subtasks.details: Provide troubleshooting steps, configuration guidance, and optimization tips tailored to the selected cloud provider's services and tools.

subtasks.title: Support Container Technology Integration
subtasks.description: Assist with the deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications using technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
subtasks.details: Help resolve issues related to container orchestration, networking, persistent storage, and security within container environments.

subtasks.title: Advise on CI/CD and Deployment Strategy
subtasks.description: Guide the design, implementation, and optimization of CI/CD pipelines and deployment strategies for robust, automated software delivery.
subtasks.details: Recommend tools, pipeline structures, and deployment patterns that align with organizational goals and technology constraints.

tasks.title: Implement Performance Engineer Agent
tasks.description: Create an agent specialized in application optimization.
tasks.details:
Implement a performance engineer agent that:
1. Analyzes application performance issues
2. Suggests optimization strategies
3. Provides guidance on performance best practices
4. Helps with performance testing and monitoring

Use Claude API with specialized performance optimization prompt. Include knowledge of performance patterns and anti-patterns. Add support for different application types and technologies. Include best practices for frontend and backend optimization. Support various performance metrics and benchmarks.
tasks.testStrategy: Test with applications containing performance issues. Verify analysis accuracy. Validate optimization suggestions. Test with different application types and technologies. Ensure guidance follows best practices and is effective.

subtasks.title: Performance Issue Analysis
subtasks.description: Identify and analyze the root causes of performance issues using established methodologies such as the USE Method, TSA Method, and Off-CPU Analysis.
subtasks.details: Gather relevant metrics, define the problem statement, and apply systematic analysis techniques to pinpoint bottlenecks or inefficiencies.

subtasks.title: Optimization Strategy Suggestion
subtasks.description: Recommend targeted optimization strategies based on the findings from the performance analysis.
subtasks.details: Suggest improvements such as code refactoring, resource allocation adjustments, or architectural changes to address identified bottlenecks.

subtasks.title: Best Practices Guidance
subtasks.description: Provide guidance on industry best practices for performance optimization and monitoring.
subtasks.details: Outline practices such as early and continuous testing, modular and system-level assessments, and user experience considerations.

subtasks.title: Performance Testing and Monitoring Help
subtasks.description: Assist in setting up and executing performance testing and monitoring processes.
subtasks.details: Define test scenarios, select appropriate tools, establish baselines, and implement continuous monitoring to capture actionable metrics.

subtasks.title: Pattern and Anti-pattern Support
subtasks.description: Identify and address common performance patterns and anti-patterns relevant to the application context.
subtasks.details: Highlight recurring issues such as sustained queue usage or blocked tasks, and recommend corrective actions.

subtasks.title: Multi-Application Type Support
subtasks.description: Ensure that performance analysis and optimization approaches are applicable across different application types (e.g., web, mobile, backend services).
subtasks.details: Adapt methodologies and recommendations to suit the specific characteristics and requirements of various application architectures.

subtasks.title: Metric and Benchmark Support
subtasks.description: Define, monitor, and interpret key performance metrics and benchmarks tailored to the system and business objectives.
subtasks.details: Establish KPIs, set thresholds, and use benchmarking to measure progress and validate optimizations.

tasks.title: Implement Project Task Planner Agent
tasks.description: Create an agent specialized in work breakdown and task planning.
tasks.details:
Implement a project task planner agent that:
1. Analyzes project requirements
2. Breaks down work into manageable tasks
3. Estimates effort and dependencies
4. Generates project plans and timelines

Use Claude API with specialized project planning prompt. Include knowledge of agile and other development methodologies. Add support for different project types and scales. Include best practices for task estimation and dependency management. Support various output formats (JSON, Markdown, Gantt charts).
tasks.testStrategy: Test with various project requirements. Verify task breakdown quality and completeness. Validate effort estimates and dependencies. Test with different project types and scales. Ensure generated plans are practical and well-structured.

subtasks.title: Requirement Analysis
subtasks.description: Gather and analyze all project requirements, objectives, and constraints to ensure a clear understanding of the project scope.
subtasks.details: Engage stakeholders to collect requirements, document project goals, and clarify deliverables. Ensure all requirements are validated and approved before proceeding.

subtasks.title: Task Breakdown Logic
subtasks.description: Decompose the project into manageable tasks and subtasks using a structured approach such as a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS).
subtasks.details: Break down high-level deliverables into smaller components, ensuring each task is actionable and measurable. Organize tasks hierarchically and document them for further planning.

subtasks.title: Effort Estimation
subtasks.description: Estimate the effort and resources required for each task and subtask identified in the breakdown.
subtasks.details: Use estimation techniques (e.g., expert judgment, analogous estimation) to assign time, personnel, and cost estimates to each task. Document assumptions and estimation methods used.

subtasks.title: Dependency Mapping
subtasks.description: Identify and document dependencies between tasks to determine sequencing and parallelization opportunities.
subtasks.details: Analyze task relationships to establish predecessor-successor links, highlight critical paths, and record all dependencies in a structured format.

subtasks.title: Project Plan and Timeline Generation
subtasks.description: Develop a comprehensive project plan and timeline based on task breakdown, effort estimates, and dependencies.
subtasks.details: Create a schedule using tools such as Gantt charts, define milestones, allocate resources, and set deadlines. Ensure the plan is realistic and aligns with project objectives.

subtasks.title: Output Format Support
subtasks.description: Implement support for multiple output formats to present the project plan and related data according to stakeholder needs.
subtasks.details: Design and develop export options (e.g., PDF, Excel, JSON) for the project plan, ensuring data integrity and readability across formats.

tasks.title: Implement Hive Mind Session Management
tasks.description: Create a system for managing multiple Claude sessions as a collaborative hive mind.
tasks.details:
Implement hive mind session management that:
1. Creates and manages multiple Claude sessions
2. Coordinates communication between sessions
3. Aggregates responses and resolves conflicts
4. Provides unified interface for interaction

Use Claude API with session management. Implement specialized roles for different sessions. Add support for parallel processing of tasks. Include mechanisms for consensus building and conflict resolution. Support different collaboration patterns (expert panel, divide-and-conquer, etc.).
tasks.testStrategy: Test with various tasks requiring multiple perspectives. Verify coordination between sessions. Validate response aggregation and conflict resolution. Test with different collaboration patterns. Ensure performance scales with the number of sessions.

subtasks.title: Multi-session Creation and Management
subtasks.description: Design and implement mechanisms for creating, tracking, and managing multiple concurrent sessions across distributed services.
subtasks.details: Define session lifecycle, unique session identifiers, and storage strategies for distributed environments. Ensure session persistence and scalability.

subtasks.title: Session Communication Coordination
subtasks.description: Establish protocols and infrastructure for coordinating communication between sessions and services.
subtasks.details: Implement message passing, event-driven updates, or shared data stores to synchronize session state and actions across distributed components.

subtasks.title: Response Aggregation
subtasks.description: Develop methods to collect, merge, and present responses from multiple sessions or services into a unified result.
subtasks.details: Handle partial responses, timeouts, and ensure data consistency when aggregating results from distributed sources.

subtasks.title: Conflict Resolution
subtasks.description: Implement strategies to detect and resolve conflicting session data or actions arising from distributed updates.
subtasks.details: Define conflict detection rules, resolution policies (e.g., last-write-wins, versioning), and user notification mechanisms.

subtasks.title: Unified Interface Implementation
subtasks.description: Design and build a single, coherent interface for interacting with and managing all sessions and their aggregated data.
subtasks.details: Ensure the interface abstracts underlying complexity, supports monitoring, and provides administrative controls.

subtasks.title: Specialized Session Roles
subtasks.description: Define and implement specialized roles or types for sessions to support differentiated behaviors or permissions.
subtasks.details: Establish role-based access, session-specific capabilities, and enforce security policies for each role.

subtasks.title: Parallel Processing Support
subtasks.description: Enable and optimize parallel processing of session operations to maximize throughput and minimize latency.
subtasks.details: Implement concurrency controls, thread-safe data structures, and load balancing for distributed session tasks.

subtasks.title: Consensus Mechanisms
subtasks.description: Integrate consensus algorithms to ensure agreement on session state and actions across distributed components.
subtasks.details: Evaluate and implement protocols such as Paxos, Raft, or custom consensus for session consistency and fault tolerance.

subtasks.title: Collaboration Pattern Support
subtasks.description: Support various collaboration patterns (e.g., leader-follower, peer-to-peer) for sessions to enable flexible workflows.
subtasks.details: Design APIs and workflows that allow sessions to interact according to different collaboration models, adapting to application needs.

tasks.title: Implement Tool Discovery and Auto-wrapping
tasks.description: Create a system for discovering and automatically wrapping external tools for Claude use.
tasks.details:
Implement tool discovery system that:
1. Scans environment for available tools and utilities
2. Generates appropriate wrappers for Claude integration
3. Registers tools in the configuration
4. Provides documentation for discovered tools

Use Node.js child_process for tool execution. Implement wrapper generation with input/output handling. Add support for different tool types (CLI, API, library). Include security validation for tool execution. Support tool versioning and compatibility checking.
tasks.testStrategy: Test with various external tools. Verify wrapper generation quality. Validate tool registration and configuration. Test with different tool types and interfaces. Ensure security measures prevent command injection.

subtasks.title: Environment Scanning for Tools
subtasks.description: Identify and catalog available tools in the target environment using automated discovery mechanisms.
subtasks.details: Implement scanning logic to detect tools, libraries, or services present in the environment. This may involve filesystem inspection, querying package managers, or leveraging APIs for dynamic discovery.

subtasks.title: Wrapper Generation Logic
subtasks.description: Develop logic to automatically generate wrappers for the discovered tools to standardize their interfaces.
subtasks.details: Create code or configuration templates that encapsulate tool invocation, input/output normalization, and error handling. Ensure wrappers are generated dynamically based on tool metadata.

subtasks.title: Tool Registration in Config
subtasks.description: Register generated wrappers and tool metadata in a centralized configuration system.
subtasks.details: Design and update a configuration file or service that tracks available tools, their wrappers, and relevant parameters for orchestration and management.

subtasks.title: Documentation Generation
subtasks.description: Automatically generate documentation for each registered tool and its wrapper interface.
subtasks.details: Produce human-readable and machine-readable documentation (e.g., Markdown, OpenAPI) describing tool usage, parameters, and expected outputs.

subtasks.title: Input/Output Handling
subtasks.description: Implement robust input and output handling mechanisms for tool wrappers.
subtasks.details: Standardize input validation, type checking, and output formatting to ensure consistency and reliability across all tool integrations.

subtasks.title: Security Validation
subtasks.description: Integrate security checks and validation into the tool execution pipeline.
subtasks.details: Perform input sanitization, permission checks, and runtime monitoring to prevent misuse or exploitation of tool wrappers.

subtasks.title: Versioning and Compatibility Checks
subtasks.description: Implement mechanisms to track tool versions and ensure compatibility with wrappers and the overall system.
subtasks.details: Check tool versions during discovery and wrapper generation, enforce compatibility constraints, and manage updates or deprecations as needed.

tasks.title: Implement Model Routing Configuration
tasks.description: Create a system for routing requests to different AI models based on task requirements.
tasks.details:
Implement model routing system that:
1. Analyzes task requirements and complexity
2. Selects appropriate AI model based on capabilities
3. Manages API keys and rate limits
4. Optimizes for cost and performance

Support multiple Claude models (Claude 3 Opus, Claude 3 Sonnet, Claude 3 Haiku). Add fallback mechanisms for service disruptions. Include cost tracking and budgeting features. Support custom routing rules and preferences. Implement caching for common requests to reduce API usage.
tasks.testStrategy: Test with various task types and complexities. Verify model selection logic. Validate API key management and rate limiting. Test fallback mechanisms with simulated disruptions. Ensure cost optimization works as expected.

subtasks.title: Task Requirement Analysis
subtasks.description: Analyze and document the detailed requirements for dynamic routing, multi-model support, optimization, and security based on the project context.
subtasks.details: Identify all functional and non-functional requirements, including expected traffic patterns, supported models, security constraints, and integration points.

subtasks.title: Model Selection Logic
subtasks.description: Design and implement logic to dynamically select the appropriate model for each request based on input parameters, context, or routing rules.
subtasks.details: Define criteria for model selection (e.g., cost, performance, accuracy, user preference) and implement a decision engine to route requests accordingly.

subtasks.title: API Key Management
subtasks.description: Establish secure API key management practices, including storage, rotation, access control, and monitoring.
subtasks.details: Implement encryption for API keys at rest and in transit, use environment variables or secret management tools, enforce least privilege access, and set up regular audits and key rotation schedules.

subtasks.title: Rate Limiting
subtasks.description: Implement rate limiting mechanisms to control API usage and prevent abuse or accidental overuse.
subtasks.details: Define per-key and per-user rate limits, integrate with API gateway or middleware, and provide clear error responses when limits are exceeded.

subtasks.title: Cost/Performance Optimization
subtasks.description: Optimize the system for cost efficiency and performance by balancing model usage, caching, and request routing.
subtasks.details: Analyze model costs, implement request batching or prioritization, and monitor system metrics to adjust routing and caching strategies for optimal resource utilization.

subtasks.title: Fallback Mechanisms
subtasks.description: Design and implement fallback strategies to ensure service continuity in case of model failures or degraded performance.
subtasks.details: Define fallback models or endpoints, implement automatic failover logic, and provide user notifications or degraded service modes as needed.

subtasks.title: Custom Routing Rules
subtasks.description: Develop and configure custom routing rules to handle specific use cases, user segments, or traffic types.
subtasks.details: Allow for rule-based overrides, A/B testing, or user-specific routing based on metadata, request content, or business logic.

subtasks.title: Caching Implementation
subtasks.description: Implement caching strategies to reduce redundant processing, improve response times, and lower operational costs.
subtasks.details: Determine cacheable endpoints, set appropriate cache lifetimes, and ensure cache consistency and invalidation policies are in place.

tasks.title: Implement Analytics Dashboard
tasks.description: Create a real-time analytics dashboard for monitoring CCDK usage and performance.
tasks.details:
Implement analytics dashboard that:
1. Collects usage and performance metrics
2. Displays real-time visualizations
3. Provides historical data analysis
4. Offers insights and recommendations

Use Express (v4.18.2+) for the backend server on port 5005. Implement Socket.IO (v4.7.2+) for real-time updates. Use Chart.js (v4.4.0+) or D3.js (v7.8.5+) for visualizations. Include authentication for dashboard access. Support different metric categories (performance, usage, errors, etc.). Implement data export functionality.
tasks.testStrategy: Test dashboard with simulated usage data. Verify real-time updates and visualizations. Validate historical data analysis. Test with different metric types and volumes. Ensure authentication works correctly and securely.

subtasks.title: Design Metric Collection Logic
subtasks.description: Define and implement the logic for collecting metrics at configurable intervals, supporting fine-grained and category-based collection.
subtasks.details: Specify which metrics to collect, set collection intervals (e.g., 1-60 seconds), and ensure support for multiple metric categories. Implement mechanisms for both standard and custom metrics.

subtasks.title: Implement Real-Time Backend Processing
subtasks.description: Develop the backend infrastructure to ingest, process, and store metrics data in real time.
subtasks.details: Use scalable message queues and distributed processing frameworks to handle high-throughput metric ingestion and real-time processing. Ensure low-latency data flow from collection to storage.

subtasks.title: Set Up Visualization Components
subtasks.description: Create dashboards and visualization tools for real-time and historical metric data.
subtasks.details: Implement interactive charts and graphs to display metrics, supporting filtering, aggregation, and drill-down by metric category and time range.

subtasks.title: Enable Historical Data Analysis
subtasks.description: Develop features for querying and analyzing historical metrics data.
subtasks.details: Provide APIs and UI components for users to query metrics over custom time ranges, aggregate data, and perform trend analysis.

subtasks.title: Develop Insights and Recommendations Logic
subtasks.description: Implement analytics to generate actionable insights and recommendations based on real-time and historical metrics.
subtasks.details: Use rule-based or machine learning approaches to detect anomalies, forecast trends, and suggest optimizations. Integrate with alerting systems as needed.

subtasks.title: Integrate Authentication Mechanisms
subtasks.description: Add secure authentication to protect metric data and system access.
subtasks.details: Implement user authentication (e.g., OAuth, SSO) and role-based access control to ensure only authorized users can access or modify metrics and visualizations.

subtasks.title: Support Multiple Metric Categories
subtasks.description: Ensure the system can handle and distinguish between different categories of metrics.
subtasks.details: Design data models and APIs to support various metric types (e.g., system, application, custom), enabling flexible querying and visualization by category.

subtasks.title: Implement Data Export Functionality
subtasks.description: Provide options for users to export metric data in various formats.
subtasks.details: Allow users to export selected metrics or analysis results as CSV, JSON, or other formats, ensuring exports respect authentication and access controls.

tasks.title: Implement Text-to-Speech Notifications
tasks.description: Create a system for providing audible notifications for important events.
tasks.details:
Implement text-to-speech notification system that:
1. Converts important events to speech notifications
2. Manages notification priority and frequency
3. Provides configuration for voice and volume
4. Supports different notification categories

Use Web Speech API for browser environments. Implement node-say (v2.0.1+) for Node.js environments. Add support for different voices and languages. Include notification queuing and throttling. Support custom notification templates. Implement do-not-disturb modes and scheduling.
tasks.testStrategy: Test with various notification types. Verify speech quality and clarity. Validate priority management and throttling. Test in different environments (browser, Node.js). Ensure configuration options work correctly.

subtasks.title: Event-to-Speech Conversion
subtasks.description: Implement a system that converts incoming notification events into spoken audio output, ensuring accurate mapping from event data to speech content.
subtasks.details: Define event types, extract relevant message content, and use a text-to-speech engine to vocalize notifications. Ensure support for multiple environments and languages as needed.

subtasks.title: Notification Priority and Frequency Management
subtasks.description: Develop logic to assign, interpret, and act on notification priority levels, and manage how frequently notifications are delivered based on their priority.
subtasks.details: Support multiple priority levels (e.g., Emergency, High, Normal, Low), configure delivery channels and escalation rules per priority, and implement frequency controls to avoid notification overload.

subtasks.title: Voice and Volume Configuration
subtasks.description: Enable configuration of voice characteristics and volume for spoken notifications, allowing customization per user or environment.
subtasks.details: Provide options for selecting voice type, language, and adjusting volume. Ensure settings can be applied globally or per notification category.

subtasks.title: Notification Category Support
subtasks.description: Implement support for categorizing notifications, allowing users to configure preferences and behaviors for different notification types.
subtasks.details: Define notification categories (e.g., system alerts, reminders, messages), allow users to set preferences for each, and ensure categories are respected in delivery and speech output.

subtasks.title: Queuing, Throttling, and Do-Not-Disturb Modes
subtasks.description: Design and implement mechanisms to queue notifications, throttle delivery rates, and enforce do-not-disturb periods based on user or system settings.
subtasks.details: Ensure notifications are queued when appropriate, limit the rate of spoken alerts to prevent overload, and suppress or defer notifications during configured do-not-disturb times.

tasks.title: Implement Swarm Execution System
tasks.description: Create a system for parallel processing of tasks using multiple Claude instances.
tasks.details:
Implement swarm execution system that:
1. Breaks down complex tasks into parallel subtasks
2. Distributes subtasks to multiple Claude instances
3. Aggregates and synthesizes results
4. Manages resource allocation and optimization

Use Claude API with parallel session management. Implement task decomposition strategies for different task types. Add support for dependency tracking between subtasks. Include progress monitoring and visualization. Support different aggregation strategies based on task type.
tasks.testStrategy: Test with complex tasks that can be parallelized. Verify task decomposition quality. Validate result aggregation and synthesis. Test with different numbers of parallel instances. Ensure performance improves with parallelization.

subtasks.title: Analyze and Select Task Decomposition Strategies
subtasks.description: Identify and evaluate suitable task decomposition strategies (e.g., recursive, data, functional, exploratory) for the problem domain, considering granularity, dependencies, and scalability.
subtasks.details: Review the problem requirements and select decomposition techniques that maximize parallelism and minimize inter-task dependencies.

subtasks.title: Design Parallel Subtask Distribution Mechanism
subtasks.description: Develop a mechanism for distributing decomposed subtasks in parallel, ensuring efficient load balancing and minimal idle time.
subtasks.details: Implement static or dynamic load balancing (e.g., master-worker, pool of tasks) based on the chosen decomposition strategy.

subtasks.title: Implement Claude Instance Management
subtasks.description: Establish a system for provisioning, monitoring, and terminating Claude instances to execute distributed subtasks.
subtasks.details: Define policies for instance lifecycle management, scaling, and fault tolerance.

subtasks.title: Develop Result Aggregation and Synthesis Logic
subtasks.description: Create logic to collect, aggregate, and synthesize results from parallel subtasks into a coherent final output.
subtasks.details: Handle partial results, manage ordering, and resolve conflicts or redundancies in aggregated data.

subtasks.title: Optimize Resource Allocation
subtasks.description: Design and implement strategies for optimal allocation and utilization of computational resources across subtasks and Claude instances.
subtasks.details: Monitor resource usage and dynamically adjust allocations to prevent bottlenecks and maximize throughput.

subtasks.title: Implement Dependency Tracking System
subtasks.description: Develop a system to track dependencies between subtasks, ensuring correct execution order and data consistency.
subtasks.details: Represent dependencies as a directed acyclic graph (DAG) and enforce execution constraints accordingly.

subtasks.title: Establish Progress Monitoring Framework
subtasks.description: Set up a framework to monitor the progress of subtasks, resource usage, and overall workflow status in real time.
subtasks.details: Provide interfaces for querying status, detecting stalled tasks, and triggering alerts or interventions.

subtasks.title: Develop Visualization Tools
subtasks.description: Create visualization tools to represent task decomposition, parallel execution, dependencies, and progress for stakeholders.
subtasks.details: Implement dashboards or graphical interfaces to display task graphs, resource allocation, and real-time progress.

subtasks.title: Integrate Aggregation Strategy Support
subtasks.description: Support multiple aggregation strategies (e.g., hierarchical, incremental, consensus-based) to flexibly synthesize results from parallel subtasks.
subtasks.details: Allow configuration or dynamic selection of aggregation methods based on task requirements and data characteristics.

tasks.title: Implement GitHub Actions Workflow Automation
tasks.description: Create a system for automating CI/CD workflows using GitHub Actions.
tasks.details:
Implement GitHub Actions automation that:
1. Generates workflow configurations for different project types
2. Integrates with CCDK testing and deployment
3. Provides templates for common CI/CD scenarios
4. Supports customization and extension

Create workflow templates for different languages and frameworks. Implement workflow generation based on project analysis. Add support for different testing and deployment strategies. Include security scanning and quality checks. Support matrix builds for cross-platform testing.
tasks.testStrategy: Test workflow generation for various project types. Verify integration with CCDK testing and deployment. Validate workflow execution in GitHub Actions. Test with different CI/CD scenarios. Ensure customization options work correctly.

subtasks.title: Workflow Template Creation
subtasks.description: Design and implement reusable workflow templates that define the structure, steps, and parameters for automated processes.
subtasks.details: Establish template naming conventions, required metadata, and parameterization for flexibility. Ensure templates can be easily instantiated and maintained.

subtasks.title: Project Analysis for Workflow Generation
subtasks.description: Analyze project requirements and characteristics to determine the appropriate workflow template and generate tailored workflows.
subtasks.details: Develop logic to map project attributes to workflow templates, supporting automated or guided selection and instantiation.

subtasks.title: Testing/Deployment Integration
subtasks.description: Integrate testing and deployment steps into the workflow templates to enable automated validation and delivery.
subtasks.details: Define standard testing and deployment actions, support environment-specific configurations, and ensure seamless integration with CI/CD tools.

subtasks.title: Scenario Template Support
subtasks.description: Enable support for multiple workflow scenarios by allowing templates to handle different use cases and branching logic.
subtasks.details: Implement conditional logic, scenario parameters, and branching to accommodate diverse workflow paths within templates.

subtasks.title: Customization/Extension Logic
subtasks.description: Provide mechanisms for users to customize or extend workflow templates to fit unique project needs.
subtasks.details: Allow injection of custom steps, overrides, or extensions while maintaining template integrity and upgradability.

subtasks.title: Security/Quality Checks
subtasks.description: Incorporate automated security and quality checks into the workflow templates to ensure compliance and code quality.
subtasks.details: Integrate static analysis, vulnerability scanning, and quality gates as mandatory steps in the workflow execution.

subtasks.title: Matrix Build Support
subtasks.description: Implement matrix build capabilities within workflow templates to support parallel execution across multiple environments or configurations.
subtasks.details: Define matrix parameters, handle result aggregation, and ensure efficient resource utilization for multi-dimensional builds.

tasks.title: Implement Post-Edit CI Trigger Hooks
tasks.description: Create hooks that trigger CI pipelines after code edits.
tasks.details:
Implement post-edit CI trigger hooks that:
1. Detect code changes and edits
2. Determine appropriate CI workflows to trigger
3. Initiate CI pipeline execution
4. Provide feedback on CI status

Use GitHub API for CI workflow triggering. Implement change detection with intelligent batching. Add support for different CI providers (GitHub Actions, CircleCI, Jenkins). Include configuration for trigger conditions and thresholds. Support manual override and confirmation for critical changes.
tasks.testStrategy: Test with various code edit scenarios. Verify trigger logic and conditions. Validate CI pipeline initiation. Test with different CI providers. Ensure feedback mechanisms work correctly.

subtasks.title: Implement Change Detection Logic
subtasks.description: Develop logic to monitor the code repository for relevant changes (e.g., commits, merges, pull requests) that should trigger CI workflows.
subtasks.details: This involves integrating with the version control system (such as Git) to detect code changes in real time or at defined intervals. The logic should be configurable to filter by branch, file path, or commit message as needed.

subtasks.title: Determine Appropriate CI Workflow
subtasks.description: Based on detected changes, decide which CI workflow(s) should be executed (e.g., full build, partial test suite, deployment pipeline).
subtasks.details: Implement rules or mapping logic to associate specific types of changes with corresponding CI workflows. This may include support for monorepos, microservices, or conditional execution based on code ownership or affected modules.

subtasks.title: Initiate CI Pipeline
subtasks.description: Trigger the selected CI pipeline(s) on the appropriate provider(s) with the correct parameters and context.
subtasks.details: Integrate with CI providers' APIs (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI) to programmatically start pipelines. Ensure that environment variables, secrets, and build parameters are correctly passed.

subtasks.title: Establish Feedback Mechanism
subtasks.description: Implement a feedback system to communicate CI results (success, failure, logs) back to developers and stakeholders.
subtasks.details: This may include posting status checks to pull requests, sending notifications via email or chat, and providing links to build logs or artifacts. Ensure feedback is timely and actionable.

subtasks.title: Enable Multi-Provider Support
subtasks.description: Design the system to support integration with multiple CI providers, allowing for flexible and scalable pipeline execution.
subtasks.details: Abstract provider-specific logic behind a common interface. Implement adapters or plugins for each supported CI provider, handling authentication, API differences, and feature variations.

subtasks.title: Configure Trigger Conditions
subtasks.description: Provide a configuration mechanism for defining and managing the conditions under which CI pipelines are triggered.
subtasks.details: Allow users to specify trigger rules (e.g., branch patterns, file globs, commit message regex) via configuration files or UI. Ensure that trigger conditions are validated and can be updated without redeploying the system.

tasks.title: Implement MkDocs Site Generation
tasks.description: Create a system for generating documentation sites using MkDocs.
tasks.details:
Implement MkDocs site generation that:
1. Creates documentation structure from project analysis
2. Generates content from code comments and docstrings
3. Builds MkDocs site with material theme
4. Supports customization and extension

Use MkDocs (v1.5.3+) with Material theme (v9.4.2+). Implement documentation extraction from different languages and frameworks. Add support for automatic API documentation generation. Include search functionality and navigation generation. Support custom themes and plugins.
tasks.testStrategy: Test documentation generation for various project types. Verify content extraction from code. Validate MkDocs site building and serving. Test with different customization options. Ensure generated documentation is complete and accurate.

subtasks.title: Documentation Structure Creation
subtasks.description: Design and establish the hierarchical structure for the documentation, including sections, navigation, and file organization.
subtasks.details: Define the main sections, pages, and navigation order in the mkdocs.yml configuration file. Ensure logical grouping and clear navigation paths for users.

subtasks.title: Content Extraction from Code
subtasks.description: Extract relevant documentation content from codebase, such as docstrings, comments, and API references.
subtasks.details: Automate or manually extract documentation from code files, converting them into Markdown format suitable for MkDocs. Ensure accuracy and completeness of extracted content.

subtasks.title: MkDocs Site Building
subtasks.description: Build the static documentation site using MkDocs based on the defined structure and extracted content.
subtasks.details: Use MkDocs commands to generate the static site. Verify that all pages render correctly and that the site builds without errors.

subtasks.title: Customization and Extension Support
subtasks.description: Implement support for custom features, extensions, or integrations as required by the documentation project.
subtasks.details: Modify mkdocs.yml and add or configure plugins, custom Markdown extensions, or other enhancements to meet project-specific needs.

subtasks.title: Search and Navigation Generation
subtasks.description: Ensure robust search functionality and intuitive navigation are generated and configured for the documentation site.
subtasks.details: Configure built-in or plugin-based search features and verify navigation menus reflect the intended structure. Test usability and accessibility.

subtasks.title: Theme and Plugin Support
subtasks.description: Select, configure, and test themes and plugins to enhance the appearance and functionality of the documentation site.
subtasks.details: Choose appropriate MkDocs themes and plugins, update mkdocs.yml accordingly, and ensure compatibility with the sites content and features.

tasks.title: Implement Deployment Preview Command
tasks.description: Create a command for generating deployment previews for web applications.
tasks.details:
Implement deployment preview command that:
1. Builds the application in preview mode
2. Serves the preview on a local development server
3. Generates shareable preview URLs
4. Provides preview status and analytics

Use ngrok (v5.0.0+) or localtunnel (v2.0.2+) for shareable URLs. Implement build process detection for different frameworks. Add support for environment variable configuration. Include preview expiration and access controls. Support different preview modes (development, staging, production).

tasks.title: Implement Changelog Generation

subtasks.title: Output Format Support

tasks.title: Implement Hook Registration System

tasks.testStrategy: Test registration of duplicate hooks to ensure only one instance is kept. Verify hooks execute in the correct order. Test hook execution with mock events. Validate error handling for failed hooks. Ensure hooks from all kits are properly registered.

tasks.title: Implement SQLite-based Memory System
tasks.description: Create the persistent memory system using SQLite to store context across Claude sessions.
tasks.details:
Implement memory persistence system using better-sqlite3 (v8.5.0+):
1. Create database schema with tables for:
   - sessions (id, start_time, end_time, metadata)
   - memory_chunks (id, session_id, content, embedding, timestamp)
   - projects (id, name, path, last_accessed)
   - context (id, project_id, key, value, timestamp)
2. Implement memory manager class with CRUD operations
3. Add indexing for performance optimization
4. Implement automatic pruning of old memories

Use prepared statements for all database operations. Implement connection pooling for performance. Add transaction support for atomic operations. Include database migration system for future schema updates.
tasks.testStrategy: Test CRUD operations on all tables. Verify persistence across application restarts. Benchmark performance for large memory operations. Test concurrent access scenarios. Validate memory pruning functionality. Ensure database integrity with foreign key constraints.

tasks.title: Implement Memory Auto-loading Hook
